intro: Sinarundinaria longispiculata, commonly known as the long-spined bamboo, is a member of the grass family (Poaceae). It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces inflorescences that consist of dense clusters of spikelets, which are typical of many bamboo species. Sinarundinaria longispiculata is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural use.
